title.narrative: 6.02 NUTRITION COVID-19 RESPONSE

description.narrative: 106/002 Governments and partners have increased capacity to provide continued access to Nutrition services and critical supplies for women and children for strengthening Infection Prevention and Control and for suppressing the COVID-19 transmission at community level, which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Child Health, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Early Childhood Development, Evaluation And Research, Maternal And Newborn Health, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition, Prevention Of Stunting And Other Forms Of Malnutrition (Covid), Social Protection, Supply And Logistics, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 6. By 2022, children and women have equitable access to knowledge and services related to COVID-19 prevention and treatment in the areas of health, nutrition, education, Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) and child protection in the most deprived areas, including Rohingya refugee camps.

title.narrative: 106/002 Governments and partners have increased capacity to provide continued access to Nutrition services and critical suppliesfor women and children for strengthening Infection Prevention and Control and for suppressing the COVID-19 transmission atcommunity level

description.narrative: The;Immediate;Socio-economic;Response Plan;(ISERP) for;COVID-19,;developed in 2020,;continued to;be the;guiding tool;for the;implementation;of nutrition services in 2021.;An;improvement;in;the coverage of essential;maternal, infant and young child nutrition (MIYCN);service;monitored through the;Priority Nutrition Reporting Indicators (PNRI);confirmed;the building-back of essential MIYCN services during the pandemic.;In Cox’s;Bazar, the coverage of essential nutrition services improved and reached the set targets. | Status:Met | As-of Date:22/12/2021
